title: @Riot : These Star Guardian Quests Ask Way Too Much of the Player(s)
body:
There isn't a place for mission issues in the discussion boards as far as I'm aware (if there is please direct me to it), so I'm hoping this is the right board.

I just saw the missions and I get it, to some degree. But to require 5 man pre-mades is ridiculous. It's hard enough for me to get a 5 man pre-made going, and I'm sure others are in this boat as well. Some are worse off, and don't have that many friends on at one time. And the difficulty besides, you've done a good job to make a challenging map, but do you honestly expect every player to have 5 friends on at a time-- all of whom are good enough to win with the challenges you impose?

This needs to be toned down. It's going to be a nightmare for me, impossible for a lot of others. Please don't require 5 man pre-mades, it's a bad idea.

Edit/Retrospect:
So, I tried a few more times but ultimately wasn't able to get friends together for the pre-made missions. Furthermore, as I'd been dealing with a bout of depression, I was playing League just to focus on something else. I couldn't even get the solo missions done because, despite being paired up with diamonds for most of my tries, we kept failing. No one stayed together, everyone wiped just before the boss. It was too frustrating; and I wasn't ready to deal with more of said frustration and the associated pressure I place on myself to complete the missions - so I didn't, I stopped playing that game mode.

So, ultimately: I stand behind everything I have said. Too much was asked of most players. Honestly, I was excited for the star guardian event, even bought a couple of skins (I'll buy the Syndra skin next, when I can). But the missions kind of killed it for me.

With the way they have made me feel, I'd be okay if missions just went away forever. I'd rather feel energized for big events and releases, not pressured.

replies.body: What I don't understand is that in one blog they ackknowledged people don't like being rectriced by what mode they must play but they found 5-man premades okay. Weird.

Responding to two different sentiments somewhat quickly:

1) Re: Premade vs Solo:
**In Short: As a solo player, you can get whichever of the two rewards you prefer, without ever entering a premade. **

The goal of the mission layout was to actually make you feel like you had a clear/ reasonable path to rewards as a Solo Player. That said, looks like the way they're displayed is throwing people off (You don't see the full flowchart), so that's something we'll talk about going forward

There's 6 missions total: 3 of them should require a premade (Get an S and the two team comps) and 3 don't (Beat base, Win as all 3 roles, Get an A). If one of those in the second set isn't unlocking as a solo, that's a bug: Please let me know and we'll try to sort it out as quickly as possible (There is some update lag we're seeing: Once you win the game, if your mission isn't updating, try leaving the EoG, then Close + Re-open mission tab)

Both "Sets" of missions give a total of 4 tokens. So as a solo player, completing every mission gets you one of your choice. 

The 3 missions we chose required premades because for the team compositions, we wanted to avoid as much champ select tension as reasonably possible ("Hey guys don't pick ADC. Oh, you did? I'm dodging"). The S was because we didn't realistically think you could do it without being coordinated, and didn't want to set the expectation you should. 

2) re: Difficulty.

Uh... yeah :) You're right, these missions, particularly the premade ones, are hard. This is the first time we've experimented with missions like this ("Do something hard" vs "Participate with these conditionals"), so we are definitely curious how they'll go, and any feedback is appreciated. In this particular case, we wanted it to be additional goals to strive for once you have beaten the mode. The missions were made for those who really enjoy the mode and are interested in mastering it, and for them, we wanted some additional commemoration, but also just fun objectives/ "Achievements" to aim for.

please tone down on the "Que as X premades " quest types.

Other Moba's like both SMITe and HON do similar things and its super annoying for solo warriors like me who enjoy playing by themselves. "b-but dont you wanna get out and make friends and blah bla-" NO! not everyone is a social animal who enjoys hanging out and giggling with buddies. like 80% of the time I just want to play league quietly alone at a time of my choosing and leisure while chilling to some nice music or my favorite streamer. 

Please do not try to force A-social people to be social. you are forcing a situation completely out of their control and it feels awful. If you want to make a quest more challenging find another way to do so. This Quest and the "Play against/ or as X champion" quest are basically the only two quest put out so far that I absolutely despise. Other than that these quest are okay.
Sorry that people are trying to make you play a team game as a team.

Do you honestly think "guys, I just want to get all the loot from this temporary game mode" is going to create lasting teams?

There are better ways to encourage someone to play League as a team game with a regular team, but it involves a *regular* (not temporary) experience. I believe the Clash stuff that was being teased on the PBE aims at taking care of that.

exactly this.
Get invited to random lobby
spend 2 hours or so knocking out the quest then go your separate ways forever.

I got carried through a game in hard mode by a diamond player.

So my question is, can a team of bronze/silver players even beat this?

Oh HEEEEEELLL no. After one game with plat player trying to carry the rest of us, I'm not even sure a bronze team could even finish the mode, let alone the damn mission. Thanks for fucking over 80% of your player base Riot.

Agreed. I don't take this game super seriously. I am definitely bronze and since I don't care about ranked, I don't care about being bronze. But that said, take it from someone who is DEFINITELY bronze. I lost 11 games of this new mode before I was matched with a full team of diamond/gold players who could carry me through it. If there's not at least two diamonds in the team, it's been a loss every time.

I think the problem is really that chat rooms where removed without anything to fill its place.

I've had a blast before with similar group quests simply because PUGs where simple and possible within the client.

Clubs feels like a dead system currently and there is no way to reach out to players within the client.

This, so much this. Previous 5 man event (like iP boost, community event) were fine because chat room was there to assemble a team of 5 easily.
5 man premade missions shouldn't  have been launch before public chat replacement were put in the new client. 

Just hope that Riot will comment on why they didn't wait

Yeah the client social systems and chat UI is utterly abysmal.

It's like discord/reddit exists so they hadn't tried too hard or did certain things just for the sake of doing it different (just what is that tucked in a corner button all in one chat/club box???). I like the old client chat interface better

And now it's gonna be hard to pull it back

There's a hard mode, and then there's what you guys have made. It's pretty much literally impossible unless you have a cosmic alignment in your favor and RNG has decided not to face-fuck you with the giant Rek'Sai and a billion skarners in the "dodge the Vel'koz bullets" escort mission. I can do all of the others just fine, with some effort, but there is no way to skillfully get through that, and it feels cheap. It feels like you're praying that RNG doesn't fuck you.
that one is a nightmare lol skarners pull u right into vel beams  and then u get triple reksai knockups  its omg there just arent any words for it
Yeah I couldn't make it past the goddamn matrix bullet time shit. Feels like you have to have 5 "chosen ones" to make it past that shit.

The boss is the best part by far, 4 huge velkoz while 4 rek sai's follow you and 3 chogath too, stopping for a second to auto them or revive means that you get knocked by rek 1, then rek 2, then cho stomp your face, and then the boss rams you while you are still flying, if you survived that, enjoy the rain of deadly bullets that not only killed you, but any ally that was close to you or in 10 metters or closer
Yeah we never made it to the boss.

Over time you get to it, but then the boss is the nightmare. The normal mode I got it first try, and I managed to end the hard mode once, but it was hell on earth and pure luck that the monsters didn't choose to gang on me and delete me on seconds more than thrice

Yeah still haven't made it past the impossible gauntlet.  Even the lure of a free champ isn't enough to make my try this more than a couple more times, and I'm just gonna say f-it. Not worth wasting my time on.

2. Once someone has done this they will not want to do it again just to help someone else who needs to compleate it. So for everone that finishes the pool for compleating drops.

3. You will just piss people off. People like compleation. Even more so with Gamers. When you add content and make it to hard or have to many road blocks you end to getting people to just leave out of frustration.

I do hope that plenty of other people will find it interesting enough to play, but I'm afraid the data at the end of the ride will show "few" people played it through till the end... which is a shame since Riot made a complete custom map for this.

Agree completely. I'm pretty damn salty that a "fun" mechanic in the game was made into such a requirement to tryhard, and for what? A ward skin.

This mode is the worst that riot has ever released hands down in many different categories.

It is completely unfriendly for new or low skilled players.

It promotes toxicity from people having to sit and grind (for easily several hours) for four quests that reward you.....a ward skin.....or!!! a champion shard...(wth?) Not only this, but the people grinding it are super salty )and who could blame them?) because they have to sit there and explain how to do each stage with each new group and hope to god they get it right or are skilled enough to pass the requirements of the stage.

Requiring people to be in a 5 pre made team is just a god awful idea. After 2 attempts with my 4 other friends who were excited about the new mode, they found it irritating and said it wasnt for them. I find a good grp of 4 randos, we grouped up and get two parts of one quest done (took us like 3 hours) and that was the best grp I got all day doing this.

Its buggy as hell. Sometimes my character will get stuck in the summoning animation while starting the countdown, making me float around like janna but stuck in this awkward position that makes it hard to dodge the millions of vel koz casts. 1350 for each regular non legendary skin (extra if you want an icon) and somehow, we just cant get the game in the type of quality you'd expect for the money being asked. I dont mind supporting, but cmon, this mode was in PBE, NO ONE caught this? I know for a fact ppl were complaining in PBE that this stuff was way too hard, but I am sure along with those complaints there were bug reports too.

The game mode is asking waaayyyyyyy too much of some people. I can go an entire mode not getting hit by one vel koz laser, but my team of 4 randos or 4 friends might get hit by like 5-6 and thats enough to wipe us.

The game is far too limited, some items are not in the mode (fine I get that), but then gold is very limited too (why?), you can only play SG characters (I also get this), and for some reason since almost all of the SG toons are squishies, each mode is littered with tanks and assassins who...if you were to get caught out with in a normal match on an adc/support/mage, you would be punished by death. And oh ya, they are buffed and you are debuffed in stats. WHY? And by the way, each restriction isn't so bad, but you tie all of these limitations together and its just... frustratingly not fun.

All of this cancer, for one simple ward skin that looks like a glorified baby rattle.

Its just not worth it. I managed to luck out and almost finish 2 of the quests out of the 3 left after the intro one. But, ya, I think I'm good. I hate grinds, this is why I dont play chinese mmo's and why I don't play WoW. Overly excessive grinds in any game are not okay for a good majority of people, I am not alone in that opinion.

This mode could have been really fun and had creative quests. Instead it is almost as if rito wanted to try and be dark souls hard thinking people would somehow enjoy this in a moba. I dont get it. 

Funny thing is, even patching a quick fix and toning it down wont even fix it at this point. Almost every group I got in to tonight had at least 1 person saying that the mode just wasn't fun. Most of these people had only played once or twice and most people seem to be really turned off from it at this point and it's only been out a day. Thats really disapointing.
As for such a beautiful event with all these new animations, skins, merch, game mode, quiz etc., missions are **totally super dull, difficult and discouraging**.
ALSO they need to increase the character select timer. theres practically no time to even communicate with your team on what mission you should go for

Lol I'm probably more upset about the fact that the rewards are either a ward, or champ permanent. It just seems silly to me. They had all this hype going for the new skins to bring this into play. I'm not going to grind with a premade for a ward or champ permanent. It just doesn't seem worth it to me.

i've tried the onslaught as tank lulu or soraka and i still cant get past the bullet hell of the level before boss. and considering all my friends just recently disowned me... thanks for rubbing it in riot. this is why i stick to aram.

Winning one time is already an HUGE challenge on onslaught, then they also had the brilliant idea to put ridicolous conditions on those wins. 

It's not like doombots where you can just ignore them and go for the towers... You can't do shit if you have velkoz placed 360° around the map shooting nonstop with skarners making sure to grab you into their projectiles just in case you want to dodge. And skarner grab is not a skillshot, you can't dodge that. 

I managed to win 1 by pure luck but i honestly felt depressed after seeing that i wasn't even being able to complete a single mission, but just 1 out of 3...

The 2nd mobile board where vels come from the back and the front is impossible to beat, ive tried it with 10 different teams, the problem isnt the enemies the problem is there are 20 vel koz sitting at the end of the board firing projectiles and between having to fight while the circle is moving down a super narrow board and being attacked by kogs and rek'sais from every side it's impossible. I've had 3 diamonds and a gold get completely demolished on that board with me. There is a destinct difference between "being hard" and being impossible, these aren't just hard, unless you have a diamond premade you aren't making it through onslaught period.

I'm skipping out on this event and encourage others to do the same! I'd understand the difficulty of the quests if the event game you something like a star guardian skin or better yet an Epic/Ultimate skin/skin shard of your choosing as well as the champ if you do not own it. But since that is not the case, then there is no possible reason as to why we should even be doing this event.
